title: Renaming ‘schizophrenia’: a step too far or not far enough?
abstract: There is no doubt that for many, the diagnosis of schizophrenia can be as debilitating as the associated symptoms. A key question in all this is whether changing the name would be enough in itself to change public attitudes and reduce self-stigma, while hopefully maintaining any potential benefits, or would such stigma become re-aligned with the new diagnostic term.
